FuncDef:
The authentication user-alarm command sets alarm thresholds for the percentage of successfully authenticated NAC users.
The undo authentication user-alarm command restores the default alarm thresholds for the percentage of successfully authenticated NAC users. The authentication user-alarm command sets alarm thresholds for the percentage of successfully authenticated NAC users. The undo authentication user-alarm command restores the default alarm thresholds for the percentage of successfully authenticated NAC users. By default, the lower alarm threshold for the percentage of successfully authenticated NAC users is 50, and the upper alarm threshold is 100. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the lower alarm threshold for the percentage of successfully authenticated NAC users.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 100. The default value is 50.

Specifies the upper alarm threshold for the percentage of successfully authenticated NAC users.
The value is an integer in the range from 1 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 100.
